title: Malik Jabir
text:
Malik Jabir (born 8 December 1944 in <a href="Wa%2C%20Ghana">Wa</a>) is a retired <a href="Ghana">Ghana</a>ian professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29%23Striker">striker</a>. He is currently a <a href="technical%20advisor">technical advisor</a> for <a href="Asante%20Kotoko%20S.C.">Asante Kotoko S.C.</a> in the <a href="Ghana%20Premier%20League">Ghana Premier League</a>.
Career.
Jabir played club football for <a href="Asante%20Kotoko">Asante Kotoko</a>.
International career.
Jabir also played for the <a href="Ghana%20national%20football%20team">Ghana national football team</a> at the <a href="1968%20Summer%20Olympics">1968</a> and <a href="1972%20Summer%20Olympics">1972 Summer Olympics</a>.
Coaching career.
Following his playing career, Jabir coached Ghana in 2003. He also coached <a href="Asante%20Kotoko">Asante Kotoko</a>, <a href="Association%20Sportive%20du%20Faso-Yennenga">ASFA Yennenga</a> of <a href="Burkina%20Faso">Burkina Faso</a> and <a href="Kano%20Pillars%20F.C.">Kano Pillars F.C.</a> of <a href="Nigeria">Nigeria</a> as Technical Adviser.
